title: Unit 1: Friends and Family - Student Handout
description: Complete student materials for a 120-minute beginner-level reading lesson focusing on introducing people and families, using present tense of 'be' and descriptive adjectives.

BLOCK 2: WHILE-READING STAGE

Reading Text: My Family and Friends

Hello! My name is Maria Gonzalez. I'm 22 years old and I'm from Spain. I'm a student at university in Madrid. I study English and Art. I'm very happy because I love my studies!

I have a big family. My mother's name is Carmen. She's 48 years old. She's a doctor at a hospital in Madrid. My mother is very kind and friendly. She's tall and she has dark hair. My father is Roberto. He's 50 years old and he's a teacher. He teaches math at a school. My father is funny and very patient. He's short and he has glasses.

I have two brothers and one sister. My brother Juan is 25 years old. He's tall like my mother. Juan is a doctor too. He works with my mother at the same hospital. He's very serious but also very nice. My other brother is Pablo. Pablo is 18 years old. He's a student at high school. Pablo is young and very active. He loves sports! My sister's name is Sofia. She's only 15 years old. Sofia is pretty and very smart. She's good at math and science.

I also have wonderful friends. My best friend is Ana. Ana is from Barcelona but now she lives in Madrid. She's 22 years old like me. We're in the same class at university. Ana is fun and very friendly. She's short and she has blonde hair. We're together every day!

I have another good friend. His name is Tom Wilson. Tom is from England. He's 23 years old. Tom is an English teacher in Madrid. He teaches children. Tom is tall and thin. He has blue eyes and brown hair. Tom is very polite and helpful. He helps me practice my English! Tom, Ana and I are good friends. We're happy together.

My family and friends are very important to me. They're wonderful people and I'm lucky to have them in my life!

Grammar Reference: Present Tense of BE

SubjectPositive (Full)Positive (Short)Example
II amI'mI'm from Spain.
YouYou areYou'reYou're nice.
HeHe isHe'sHe's a teacher.
SheShe isShe'sShe's 22 years old.
ItIt isIt'sIt's big.
WeWe areWe'reWe're friends.
TheyThey areThey'reThey're students.
Question FormExampleShort Answer
Am I...?Am I late?Yes, you are. / No, you aren't.
Are you...?Are you from Spain?Yes, I am. / No, I'm not.
Is he/she/it...?Is he a doctor?Yes, he is. / No, he isn't.
Are we...?Are we friends?Yes, we are. / No, we aren't.
Are they...?Are they students?Yes, they are. / No, they aren't.

Grammar: BE + Adjective (Describing People)

We use BE + ADJECTIVE to describe people:

StructureExamples
Subject + BE + AdjectiveMy mother is kind.
Tom is tall.
They are friendly.
We are happy.

Useful Adjectives to Describe People:

Personality: nice, kind, friendly, funny, serious, polite, helpful, smart, patient, active
Appearance: tall, short, thin, pretty, young, old
Feelings: happy, sad, lucky, tired
